intro: Crataegus monogyna var. odemisii, commonly known as the Odemisii hawthorn, is a rare variant of the common hawthorn. It is characterized by its distinctive floral and foliar features, including unique petal shapes and leaf venation patterns. Native to a limited geographic region, this variety is often found in specific microhabitats within its native range. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Its botanical significance lies in its genetic distinctiveness and ecological role within its habitat.
